title: Thomas Phinney
content:
**[Indices](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014143508/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Indices) : Thomas W. Phinney** (1965-)

Long-time [Adobe Systems](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014143508/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Adobe%20Systems) employee (1997-2008) where he was the initial author (2005-08) of [typblography](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014143508/http:/typophile.com/wiki/typblography), and lastly Product Manager for Fonts and Global Typography. Currently Senior Product Manager for Fonts & Typography at Extensis (2009-). Frequent conference speaker, often involved in evangelism and technical assistance relating to [OpenType](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014143508/http:/typophile.com/wiki/OpenType). Distant relative of [Joseph W. Phinney](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014143508/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Joseph%20W.%20Phinney) of [American Type Founders](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014143508/http:/typophile.com/wiki/American%20Type%20Founders) fame. Reportedly can be summoned by means of the [Phinn-signal](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014143508/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Phinn-signal). Designer of the typeface Hypatia Sans.

Phinney has an MS in Graphic Arts Printing, specializing in design and typography, from the Rochester (NY) Institute of Technology, and an MBA from the University of California at Berkeley.

For most of his time at Adobe, he reported to [David Lemon](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014143508/http:/typophile.com/wiki/David%20Lemon), and worked with colleagues including [Robert Slimbach](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014143508/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Robert%20Slimbach) and [Christopher Slye](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014143508/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Christopher%20Slye).
